meanings.definition: To serve as a lackey or servant.
meanings.sent1: He was lackeying for the wealthy businessman, carrying his bags and running errands.
meanings.sent2: The butler was lackeying for the royal family, attending to their every need.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to be lackeying for the cat, following it around and fetching its toys.
meanings.sent4: The politician was accused of lackeying for the special interest groups, always doing their bidding.
meanings.sent5: The robot was lackeying for its human master, obeying every command without question.

meanings.sent1: She was lackeying to her boss, constantly praising his ideas and agreeing with everything he said.
meanings.sent2: The villain was lackeying to the evil queen, bowing before her and carrying out her wicked plans.
meanings.sent3: The cat was lackeying to the mouse, pretending to be afraid while secretly plotting its escape.
meanings.sent4: The employee was accused of lackeying to the supervisor, always seeking approval and never voicing dissent.
meanings.sent5: The student was lackeying to the teacher, always volunteering to help and never questioning assignments.
